title: backhand index pointing left: light skin tone

adjectives: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north
The opposite of right; toward the west when one is facing north.
The west side of the body when one is facing north.
nouns: One of the long extremities of the hand, sometimes excluding the thumb.
A part of the hand
One of the long extremities of the hand that is used for gripping objects.
Extremity of the hand.
Any of the terminal members of the hand (sometimes excepting the thumb)
Organ of manipulation and sensation found in the hands of humans and other primates
A finger is a limb of the human body and a type of digit, an organ of manipulation and sensation found in the hands of humans and other primates.
The left side or direction.
The most common relative directions are left, right, forward, backward, up, and down.
One direction or side, as opposed to right. The west side of the body when one is facing north.
A downward direction
The left side.
Location near or direction toward the left side; i.e. the side to the north when a person or object faces east
Up, down, left, right, forwards, backwards
That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
Part of the fore limb.
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.
The use of movements, especially of the hands, to communicate familiar or prearranged signals
A gesture is a form of non-verbal communication or non-vocal communication in which visible bodily actions communicate particular messages, either in place of, or in conjunction with, speech.
Form of non-verbal communication or non-vocal communication
A quick movement of a finger or pen on a screen that the computer interprets as a command, rather than as a mouse movement, writing, or drawing.
The use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals
Something that serves to indicate or suggest
Anything serving to indicate or point out, as a sign or token.
That which serves to indicate or point out; mark; token; sign; symptom; evidence.
That which serves to indicate or point out.

description: This version of the  Backhand Index Pointing Left emoji has the  Light Skin Tone applied, which is displayed as a Pale Skin Tone on supp
apple_vendor_description: The backhand index pointing left emoji on Apple devices presents a finely rendered hand with a light skin tone, depicted with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading. Its index finger extends with a subtle upward curve, and the soft rounded edges of the knuckles and fingernail convey a gentle yet clear direction.  This emoji, as seen on Apple devices, is perfect for subtly guiding attention to content on the left side of a screen or in a conversation.
